properties.name: 10th House
properties.description: Posted by AsiabruinCagayan De Oro City in Mindanao, Philippines. After two weeks in Makati, Manila, I worked in Cagayan for two months in June-August 1981. What a beautiful little city! And a great learning time. Others there at the same time were Bob & Judi Pyke and Brad Johnson.

properties.name: 11th House
properties.description: Posted by Asiabruin3724 Artesia Blvd, Lakewood CAJune 22, 1985 Kimberly and I got married and after two weeks\' honeymoon in Kauai and Maui, moved into our first apartment, a two bedroom place in the "Empress Apartments." We were in unit #32. Other friends we made there were Max Witham and Alvie Crisp. Kimberly drove one way to work in La Mirada, and I drove the other way to Rolling Hills. We enjoyed our little place and getting to know our neighborhood.

properties.name: 12a House
properties.description: Posted by AsiabruinWe took a sabbatical in Spring 1989 and spent three months in Chicago attending North Park University, March-May. We had a beautiful apartment in an old brownstone three storey building, which is no longer there. We could go out our back door and walk across the alley to the school. We also enjoyed the end of winter and beginning of Spring, watching Chicago transform from a drab brown to a blooming green city.

properties.name: 12th House
properties.description: Posted by Asiabruin1418 Brett Place #124, San Pedro, CAJune 1, 1987 we bought our 3-bedroom condominium at "Harbor Gate." It was a perfect place for us, and we loved our ten years there until June 1997. This is where Tyler lived his first four years, and Cameron his first 9 months. We also had a little dog named Kiwi. Our first neighbors were Steve & Margie Lung, who had told us about the place one morning at church. We went over after lunch, and paid a deposit that day - love at first sight! We still own the place and figure we will retire there, and have been blessed with a wonderful family renting from us since 1997, Hermie & Ellen.

properties.name: 13th House
properties.description: Posted by AsiabruinIn September 1997 we packed up our two little boys and moved to Kunming, China, to become language students at Yunnan University. What a change! We lived in the foreign students dormitory, in two adjacent rooms on the 4th floor (our first few months were on the first floor). We loved Kunming and we loved the friends we made there.

properties.name: 14th House
properties.description: Posted by Asiabruin18 Eastfield, Rolling Hills, CAAfter we left China, we had three months in the US before moving to Singapore. Since we had long-term renters in our condo in San Pedro, friends of us let us come stay with them. Cole & Barb Shoemaker had built their dream house while we were away, and they had lots of spare room. We had a great time with their family and enjoyed a higher-class lifestyle during those months than we ever had before, or ever will have again!

properties.name: 15th House
properties.description: Posted by AsiabruinIn December 1999 we moved into an "HDB" flat in Tampines, Singapore. Block 856B Tampines Street 82, on the fourth floor. It was a beautiful 3 bedroom place that was a nice home for us from Dec 99 until September 2002. It was actually picked for us by our friend and realtor Judy Owyong. We had picked a similar one in the same block when we got our employment pass and signed the boys up for school in September, but the lease fell through while we were in the US for a visit. The boys both rode buses to school during the three years we stayed here. I rode the MRT downtown to work. Our third year we bought a car, which made our lives much easier, and happier. It was while we were in this house that Rascal and Loonni came to join us.

properties.name: 16th House
properties.description: Posted by AsiabruinWhen our lease was up on Street 82, we moved a few blocks away to Block 120 Tampines Street 11. Sept 02-June05. It was on a quiet little street, not as noisy as St 82, and was across the street from the boys\' school, Qiaonan Primary School. This place was an "HUDC" flat. It was also 3 bedroom, but was 2-storey, and a little bigger than our HDB. We had a great three years in this house and enjoyed our lives here. The boys especially like walking to school and having classmates in the same neighborhood. Cameron spent every day from 5-6pm on the playground downstairs, and Tyler liked to go to Killiney Kopitiam across the street.

properties.name: 17th House
properties.description: Posted by AsiabruinIn June 2005 we moved to Teresaville at 1007 Lower Delta Road. After eight years of living on the fourth floor, we now live on the 23rd floor! We\'ve got a magnificent view of downtown and the harbor! We moved here to be in walking distance of the boys\' new school, International Community School. This is a condominoum, which means we are really spoiled. We\'ve got a pool downstairs, wonderful grounds, and a huge place. Our flat is two stories, and for the first time the boys have their own bedrooms. We also have the luxury of a guest room, and an area Jim uses as an office. We love our place, but will only be here until June 2007, because the owners hope to get higher rent after that.

properties.name: 1st House
properties.description: Posted by Asiabruin 1711 Tyler Drive, Monterey Park, CAThis is the first house I remember. We moved there when I was two, and stayed until I was ten, 1959-1967.

properties.name: 2nd House
properties.description: Posted by Asiabruin3824 Oakes Drive, Hayward, CAThis is where we lived from 1967-1969, when I was 11 and 12 years old.

properties.name: 3rd House
properties.description: Posted by Asiabruin 772 El Mirador Drive, Fullerton, CAThis is where my family moved in 1969, and where my Mom still lives today. I was 13 when we moved in, and 18 when I moved out to go to college. I moved back for four years during graduate school and internship from 1981-1985.

properties.name: 4th House
properties.description: Posted by AsiabruinWhen I was 18 I moved out of my parents\' home for the first time and moved into a dormitory at UCLA where I stayed for 2 years. I lived in Hedrick Hall, which from 1975-1977 was the newest and nicest of UCLA\'s four dorms.

properties.name: 5a House
properties.description: Posted by AsiabruinIn the summer of 1978 I spent a term at Pembroke College in Cambridge, England. Studying Victorian literature and the Industrial Revolution were ok, but hanging out in this great little college town was terrific! I wasn\'t ready for the cold, however, and bought a wool sweater that I seemed to wear every day through summer. "Punting" on the river Cam was a highlight, as well as pastries at tea time and going out for beer and darts in the great pubs in the evenings. My two good friends that summer were Jon Dorsey and Jeff Carr. Jon and I then spent the next four weeks after school traveling around Europe, meeting up with Jeff in Paris and other friends along the way. Right out of Cambridge, though, we made a beeling for Spain and the warm beach of Sitges outside barcelona.

properties.name: 5th House
properties.description: Posted by Asiabruin525 1/2 Landfair Ave, Los Angeles, CAThis is the first apartment I moved into, with friends from Hedrick Hall: Bob Mok, Paul Wilson, and Bill Bower. Later in the year Andy Park joined us. We were there for one year 1977-1978.

properties.name: 6th House
properties.description: Posted by AsiabruinMy final year at UCLA we lived on Westgate Avenue and took the #10 bus down Santa Monica Blvd to UCLA, my only year of commuting. Bob Mok, Scott Otterness, and Ruben Hernandez, with Kevin Warner joining us later in the year. When I moved out, Steve Angius moved in and they stayed there another year. This was a great year with the "Westgate Clan," 1978-1979.

properties.name: 7th House
properties.description: Posted by AsiabruinI moved to Guam in 1979 and spent a year in Magnilao working at the Universtiy of Guam. Stayed in an apartment with Rick Langer, Russ Greene, and Steve Edgington, and had a great year.

properties.name: 8th House
properties.description: Posted by AsiabruinMay - October 1980, I lived in Calcutta. I was working with six others on a campaign called Here\'s Life. After spending two weeks in Bangalore getting training, and two weeks in Lucknow giving some training, we settled in at the YWCA just off Park Street. I roomed with Jim Cunningham, and the others were Steve Edgington, Duane Walters, Steve Barrett, Glen ? and Sankaran from Singapore. We had some great adventures and learned a lot. Not sure where exactly to find it on this map, and I\'ve never been back to India.

properties.name: 9th House
properties.description: Posted by AsiabruinI went back to Guam for another year, October 1980-May 1981. I lived in a house in Barrigada. Downstairs were Russ Greene, Kerry Jones, Doug Cummings, and Ham Willis. Upstairs were 4 girls including Laurie Brast. During the year I worked on Anderson Air Force Base in the far north of the island.
